title: Projects
text: Here you will find links to to some of my current projects on GitHub, followed by a listing of my past academic research with links to retrospective write-ups.

title: Projects
text:
On-going projects

Python implementation of an agent-based model of a minimal economy developed by Steilgitz et al.
Data gathering, analysis, and modelling in relation to carbon market price dynamics.

title: Projects
text:
Academic research




  




T-matrix calculations





Development and testing of software for T-matrix calculation of light scattering by assemblies of particles.




 




  




Nanoalloys structure prediction





Global optimisation Algorithm development and application in theoretical structure prediction of mixed metal clusters.




 




  




Gallium superatoms





Superatom analysis of the electronic structure of metalloid gallium clusters.




 




  




Nanoscale capillary action





Molecular dynamics simulation and thermodynamic modelling of capillary absorption of metal nanodroplets.




 




  




Melting of atomic clusters





Molecular dynamics simulation and thermodynamic modelling of metal nanoclusters melting.

title: Dmitri Schebarchov
text:

Welcome to my website!
I am a computational modeller with PhD in physics and extensive postdoctoral experience in simulation-based research, including methods development.
Most of my academic work revolved around nanoscale materials modelling; but, after joining a fin-tech startup, my interests broadened to include agent-based modelling of socio-economic systems: markets, emissions trading schemes, and blockchain networks.
To branch out even more, I intend to pursue a number of data science projects and use this website for (i) blogging about my learnings and (ii) showcasing my (past and current) work.
Please, feel free to visit my Blog, explore my Projects, download my CV, or reach out by e-mail.
